content.webTitle: L&G may lobby for FSA change

fields.headline: L&G may lobby for FSA change
fields.bodyText: Legal & General is considering making an application to the Financial Services and Markets Tribunal to ask for changes to the regulatory process at the FSA. In its ruling on L&G's appeal against a £1.1m fine for endowment mis-selling by the FSA, the tribunal revealed it had little known powers to recommend changes at the regulator if it was asked to do so by a "third party". L&G admitted its board was "looking at that course of action", while also trying to have its £2m legal costs repaid and its fine quashed after the tribunal ruled that the FSA had failed to prove widespread mis-selling. The tribunal did agree with the FSA that there had been problems with L&G's procedures.
